concept.title: Generic topics
concept.shortdesc: You can use generic topics for any content that cannot be fit into one of the core DITA topic types.

conbody.p: For example, samples and examples are best documented using the generic topic markup, since they aren't really concepts, tasks, or reference information. Do not use generic topics just because the task or reference markup is too restrictive: if you have a task that doesn't fit the markup, you may need to rewrite the task. The rules expressed by DITA are the best practices for writing each of the topic types. If you are unsure how to map your tasks or reference information into the existing document types, ask for direction from an editor or submit a question to IDWB support.
